_description: ‘Vite Ade et Eue’ — a fragment in couplets

NLS1921.Last Lines:
…ȝif ous grace for to winneÞe ioie þat adam now
                    is inne
NLS1921.Note:
Two fragments of text; first of 352 lines, begins and ends imperfectly
                    (see Edinburgh,  Edinburgh University Library 218, below); second of 428 lines, begins imperfectly; 780
                    lines in couplets.
NLS1921.Facsimiles:
Pearsall,  Derek,  and  I. C. Cunningham, eds.  
             The Auchinleck Manuscript. National Library of Scotland
                Advocates’ MS. 19.2.1.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.

EDU218.Last Lines:
…In what lorde þat ich [ ]y no haue in [ ]þar
                    may on [ ]…
EDU218.Note:
Two leaves, formerly between ff. 13 and 14 of Edinburgh,  National Library of Scotland, Advocates’ 19.2.1 [Auchinleck MS]: 352
                    lines, end damaged by damp.
EDU218.Editions:
Laing,  David,
                        ed.  
             A Penni Worth of Witte, Florice and Blauncheflour….
Abbotsford Club
         29. Edinburgh, 1857: 49-75.
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Sammlung altenglischer Legenden.
         Heilbronn: Henninger, 1878: 138-47.
